analyzed: paṭṭhāna pakaraṇa  dhamma anuloma paccanīya tika paṭṭhāna pāḷi
translated: The Book of Conditional Relations🔽The Threefold Conditional Relations

original: Dassanena pahātabbahetukaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nadassanena pahātabbahetuko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: dassanena pahātabba hetukam dhammam paṭicca na dassanena pahātabba hetukaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With cause to be abandoned by seeing: with cause to be abandoned by seeing as condition, a state with cause not to be abandoned by seeing arises, by way of condition being a root cause. (Condensed.)

original: Hetuyā chabbīsa, ārammaṇe ekavīsa, adhipatiyā ekūnavīsa …pe… vipāke tīṇi …pe… avigate chabbīsa. (Vitthāretabbaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā chabbīsa ārammaṇe ekavīsa adhipatiyā ekūnavīsa pe vipāke tīṇi pe avigate chabbīsa vitthāretabba
translated: In the root cause, there are twenty-six; in the object, twenty-five; in the predominance, nineteen. … In the fruit, there are three. … In the unincluded, twenty-six. (To be elaborated.)
